com.turbomanage.httpclient
Interface RequestHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicRequestHandler
public interface RequestHandler

Interface that defines the request lifecycle used by AbstractHttpClient. RequestHandler is composed of many sub-interfaces so that each handler can be set independently if needed. You can provide your own implementation by providing it in the client constructor. See BasicRequestHandler for a simple implementation.

Author:
David M. Chandler

openConnection

java.net.HttpURLConnection openConnection(java.lang.String url)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
Opens an HTTP connection.

Parameters:
url - Absolute URL
Returns:
an open HttpURLConnection
Throws:
java.io.IOException

prepareConnection

void prepareConnection(java.net.HttpURLConnection urlConnection,
                       HttpMethod httpMethod,
                       java.lang.String contentType)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Prepares a previously opened connection. It is called before writing to the OutputStream, so it's possible to set or modify connection properties. This is where to set the request method, content type, timeouts, etc.

Parameters:
urlConnection - An open connection
httpMethod - The request method
contentType - MIME type
Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeStream

void writeStream(java.io.OutputStream out,
                 byte[] content)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Writes to an open, prepared connection. This method is only called when URLConnection.getDoOutput() is true and there is non-null content.

Parameters:
out - An open OutputStream
content - Data to send with the request
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readStream

byte[] readStream(java.io.InputStream in)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Reads from the InputStream.

Parameters:
in - An open InputStream
Returns:
Object contained in the response
Throws:
java.io.IOException

onError

boolean onError(HttpRequestException e)
Invoked for any exceptions. Of particular interest are ConnectException SocketTimeoutException

Parameters:
e - The exception that was thrown
Returns:
true if recoverable. Async clients may use this to try again
